alston.minecraft

Class Main

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jme3.app.Application
      • com.jme3.app.SimpleApplication
        • alston.minecraft.Main
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.jme3.system.SystemListener

    public final class Main
extends com.jme3.app.SimpleApplication
    The main class and therefore entry point, and serves the purpose of containing the majority of the static variables and Object prototypes (Prototype design pattern) that are the same and will not change for all instances of Game, as well as constants, useful refrences (such as to the main thread), and all initiations for those variables/prototypes. It also act as the main bridge between the program written to the JMonkey library, by having the Objects react using implmentations of abstract methods from the SimpleApplication class. Note that the Main class is final so it cannot be subclassed, as it uses a Singleton design pattern and therefore has a private constructor. A Singleton is used due to the fact that the other class must access non-static fields/methods in it's superclass (SimpleApplication), and therefore needs an instance of Main in order to do so. However there must only be one instance of Main, and hence the Singleton.

      static com.jme3.system.AppSettings APP_SETTINGS
      Contains important information of the application, such as screen dimensions.
      static boolean FLY_MODE

      static int MAX_BLOCKS_Y
      Defines the number of Block per Chunk in the Y axis.
      static boolean SAVE_ENABLED
      Saves game to a file upon exit if true, pernamently discards game upon exit if false.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void destroy()
      Called whenever the program is stopped, with the method of which it was stopped irrelevant (will be called even if it the Main thread threw and uncaught exception and crashed); stops all other Threads to prevent other Threads of running after the program stops.

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        This is the main method of the program, and therefore entry point. Prepares the logger settings, as well as creating a new instance of the Main class, which is nessecary to use the inherited non-static methods from SimpleApplication. It also defines at what settings the SimpleApplication will run at. Should not be explicitly called.
        Parameters:
        args - Useless/Not Used. Only a parameter as a result of convention.

      • simpleInitApp

        public void simpleInitApp()
        Called by the super class SimpleApplication upon creation to set up variables and Objects, as well as calling initialization methods for the title screen.
        Specified by:
        simpleInitApp in class com.jme3.app.SimpleApplication

      • simpleUpdate

        public void simpleUpdate(float tpf)
        Called by the SimpleApplication super class for every frame. It is called by the main/render Thread, so any changes in scene graph is Thread-safe. The code contained in this method checks on other threads, and updates the camera to the player's location.
        Overrides:
        simpleUpdate in class com.jme3.app.SimpleApplication
        Parameters:
        tpf - The time interval between the current frame and the previous

      • getInstance

        public static Main getInstance()
        Used to get the Singleton instance of Main (instanceof SimpleApplication). Lazy initiation not used due to the fact that instance would've already been initated before any classes could call this (initated in main method).
        Returns:
        The current instance of Main

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Called whenever the program is PROPERLY exited; saves the current Game to a file if SAVE_ENABLED is true, or else it does nothing.
        Overrides:
        stop in class com.jme3.app.Application

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        Called whenever the program is stopped, with the method of which it was stopped irrelevant (will be called even if it the Main thread threw and uncaught exception and crashed); stops all other Threads to prevent other Threads of running after the program stops.
        Specified by:
        destroy in interface com.jme3.system.SystemListener
        Overrides:
        destroy in class com.jme3.app.Application
